job_title: Research Assistant & PhD Candidate in Madrid
pros:
Most Professors and Senior Researchers are very committed to the job, passionate about research and very respected in the industry. 
In general, quality of work is very high, the level is demanding and analysis are rigorous and independent (not influenced by project partners).
Assistant researchers can learn a lot.
The ambient with colleagues is very good, people very friendly and is always willing to help each other.
Supervisors are usually very flexible and allow research assistant to grow and learn.
It has become more international, so it is easier now for non-Spanish to integrate.
cons:
The university itself is not very flexible and does not value research as it should.
Research assistants are "forever linked" to their supervisor: it is important to have good luck and get a good supervisor!
It is not easy to get a position as a Researcher or as a Professor in the University, and this depends much more on your supervisor than on personal merit and achievement.
